title: Site Reliability Engineer - Operations (PST Timezone)
description:
Skyflow is a data privacy vault company built to radically simplify how companies isolate, protect, and govern their customers’ most sensitive data. With its global network of data privacy vaults, Skyflow is also a comprehensive solution for companies around the world looking to meet complex data localization requirements. Skyflow currently supports a diverse customer base that spans verticals like fintech, retail, travel, and healthtech.
   

  

 Skyflow is headquartered in Palo Alto, California and was founded in 2019\\. For more information, visit www.skyflow.com or follow on X and LinkedIn.
   

  

**About The Role**
 As a Site Reliability Engineer, you will be responsible for driving the effort to identify, design, and develop the best technical and field solutions to automate our production systems. This position will collaborate often with various internal and external business and engineering teams. You will also have an opportunity to lead efforts to champion and instill a culture of Site Reliability Engineering at Skyflow.
   

  

 We know great Site Reliability Engineers come from diverse technical backgrounds, so no single individual may have all the desired skills on day one. But if you are the kind of software engineer who would have loved to engineer solutions for Stripe or Twilio API's, or the Slack or Zendesk app, or the Snowflake or MongoDB platform \\- we want to talk to you
   

  

**You Have**
* 2\\+ years in infrastructure automation and SRE\\-driven software delivery.
* Strong experience with at least one major cloud platform (AWS preferred; Azure or GCP acceptable).
* Programming experience in Go (preferred) or Python.
* Hands\\-on experience with: Infrastructure as Code: Terraform, CloudFormation CI/CD tools: Jenkins Configuration management: Ansible Containers \\& orchestration: Docker, Kubernetes Linux systems engineering and scripting for automation RDBMS and production\\-grade infrastructure
* Deep understanding of site reliability practices, observability patterns, and operational excellence.
* Experience working with large\\-scale, distributed infrastructures.
* Ability to collaborate with distributed global teams, providing technical guidance and leadership.


**You Will**
* Provide operational support aligned with US time zones, ensuring system reliability and availability.
* Design, build, and maintain highly available and scalable cloud infrastructure using AWS and modern SRE practices.
* Develop and maintain CI/CD pipelines for automated testing, building, and deployment of applications.
* Automate infrastructure provisioning, configuration, and deployment using Terraform, CloudFormation, Helm, and Ansible.
* Work extensively with Docker and Kubernetes for container orchestration and service management.
* Implement and maintain observability solutions including monitoring, logging, alerting, and tracing.
* Evaluate and improve reliability, performance, scalability, and security of production systems.
* Support migration and modernization initiatives, choosing the right approach based on prior experience.
* Collaborate with cross\\-functional teams and clients to deliver robust, cloud\\-based solutions and best\\-in\\-class customer experiences.
* Act as a thought leader within the SRE team, contributing to processes, standards, and the overall SRE culture.


**Benefits**
* Work from home expense
* Excellent Health Insurance Options
* Very generous PTO
* Flexible Hours
* Generous Equity


 At Skyflow, we believe that diverse teams are the strongest teams. We invite applicants of all genders, races, ethnicities, nationalities, ages, religions, sexual orientations, disability statuses, educational experiences, family situations, and socio\\-economic backgrounds.

title: ServiceNow Developer
description:
We are seeking a highly skilled
 **ServiceNow Developer** 
 with deep expertise in ITOM \\& ITSM to drive modernization efforts on the ServiceNow platform. This role is integral to designing, implementing, and optimizing advanced ServiceNow solutions that enhance IT operations, automate workflows, and improve service reliability.
   

  

 As a key member of the Cloud Information Services (CIS) team, you will work closely with architects, developers, and administrators to design and deploy scalable solutions while ensuring best practices in ServiceNow ITOM, ITSM, and other ServiceNow product areas. The ideal candidate is a strategic thinker with extensive hands\\-on experience in ServiceNow ITOM modules such as Discovery, Service Mapping, Event Management, and Cloud Management, along with a strong background in automation, integrations, and performance optimization.
   

  

**Key Responsibilities**
* Lead the design, development, and implementation of ITOM solutions within ServiceNow, focusing on Discovery, Service Mapping, Event Management and CMDB to enhance IT operations and asset visibility.
* Design and optimize workflows, automation, and integrations that align ServiceNow capabilities with enterprise IT strategies, ensuring seamless connectivity with external systems and cloud environments.
* Provide expertise in ITSM module implementations, including Incident Management, Change Management, Service Catalog, and Service Portal, to improve IT service delivery.
* Collaborate with stakeholders across IT and business units to analyze requirements, define technical specifications, and deliver scalable, high\\-performance solutions.
* Drive best practices in ServiceNow development, including scripting (JavaScript, PowerShell), business rules, UI policies, and API integrations (REST, SOAP, LDAP, MID Servers).
* Ensure accuracy and integrity of the CMDB, driving best practices for data governance, reconciliation, and automation.
* Support DevOps and Agile development workflows, participating in backlog refinement, requirements decomposition, and iterative solution delivery.
* Troubleshoot and resolve complex ServiceNow platform issues, ensuring high availability, security, and performance.
* Stay ahead of industry trends and ServiceNow advancements, identifying opportunities to enhance platform capabilities and drive innovation.
* Mentor junior developers and contribute to documentation of technical solutions, best practices, and operational guidelines.


**Required Qualifications**
* 5\\-10 years of hands\\-on ServiceNow development and administration experience, with deep expertise in ITOM and ITSM.
* Proven expertise in ITOM modules such as Discovery, Service Mapping, Event Management and CMDB best practices.
* Strong proficiency in ServiceNow development (scripting, workflows, business rules, integrations) and automation capabilities.
* Experience integrating ServiceNow with enterprise systems using REST/SOAP APIs, LDAP, and MID Servers.
* Proficiency in JavaScript, PowerShell, and HTML for advanced customizations and automation.
* Ability to assess, troubleshoot, and optimize system configurations for performance, scalability, and security.
* Strong analytical and problem\\-solving skills, with the ability to translate complex business needs into technical solutions.
* Excellent communication and stakeholder management skills, with the ability to influence technical decisions and drive adoption.
* Commitment to IT security best practices, ensuring compliance with data confidentiality, integrity, and governance policies.
* Should be ready to work during EMEA Business hours (3 PM – 11 PM)


 This role is ideal for a
 **seasoned ServiceNow ITOM expert** 
 who is passionate about leveraging automation, optimizing IT operations, and delivering cutting\\-edge solutions on the ServiceNow platform. If you thrive in a collaborative environment and want to shape the future of IT service management, we invite you to join our team.

title: Senior Engineer- APA Predictive Analysis
description:
****Job Requirements****
 At Quest Global, it’s not just what we do but how and why we do it that makes us different. With over 25 years as an engineering services provider, we believe in the power of doing things differently to make the impossible possible. Our people are driven by the desire to make the world a better place—to make a positive difference that contributes to a brighter future. We bring together technologies and industries, alongside the contributions of diverse individuals who are empowered by an intentional workplace culture, to solve problems better and faster.
   

  

****Requirements****
**Job Requirements**
**Model Development, Verify P\\&ID and fill TDT Excel with available tags (transmitter) in P\\&ID**
**Verify availability of tags in PI server / Cloud server**
**Building models in PRiSM**
**Deploying Operational profile**
**Verify results in PRiSM Web and retrain the model in PRiSM Client, if necessary**
**Proposing the necessary TDT Metrics for a model**
**(Ex: Compressor Mech/ Process/Seal…)**
**Proposing various faults to be included in a model template**
**Building Templates in PRiSM**
**Creating Fault Diagnostics overview including adding faults, description, next steps and deviation summary**
****Requirements****
**Work Experience**
**Model Development, Verify P\\&ID and fill TDT Excel with available tags (transmitter) in P\\&ID**
**Verify availability of tags in PI server / Cloud server**
**Building models in PRiSM**
**Deploying Operational profile**
**Verify results in PRiSM Web and retrain the model in PRiSM Client, if necessary**

**(Ex: Compressor Mech/ Process/Seal…)**
**Proposing various faults to be included in a model template**
**Building Templates in PRiSM**
**Creating Fault Diagnostics overview including adding faults, description, next steps and deviation summary**

title: Sr. SBC Developer
description:
**Description**
 Sangoma, a leader in business communications solutions, is looking for a highly skilled Sr. SBC Developer to join our dynamic team. As a reputable provider of Unified Communications as a Service (UCaaS) solutions, we are focused on delivering high\\-quality products that optimize voice and communication services for businesses around the globe. In this role, you will play a critical part in developing and enhancing our Session Border Controller (SBC) products, ensuring they meet the highest standards of performance and security.
   

  

 Your expertise in SBC technologies will drive our innovation and growth in the VoIP and telecommunications space. If you are passionate about developing cutting\\-edge solutions and making a significant impact in a fast\\-paced environment, we would love to hear from you.
   

  

**Your Role**
* Design and develop robust Session Border Controller solutions to facilitate secure and reliable VoIP communication.
* Manage the integration of SBC products with various telecommunication systems and services.
* Optimize performance and scalability of SBC applications through rigorous testing and debugging.
* Collaborate with cross\\-functional teams to define product specifications and requirements.
* Stay current with industry trends and emerging technologies to ensure our SBC solutions remain competitive.
* Participate in code reviews, ensuring adherence to coding standards and best practices.
* Provide technical guidance and mentorship to junior developers on the team.


**Requirements**
* Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or a related field.
* Proven experience as a Developer with a strong focus on Session Border Controllers (SBC).
* Expertise in VoIP protocols (e.g., SIP, RTP) and understanding of telecommunications architecture.
* Experience with programming languages such as C, C\\+\\+, or Java.
* Familiarity with network security protocols and best practices.
* Strong analytical and problem\\-solving skills.
* Excellent communication skills and ability to work collaboratively in a team environment.


**Benefits**
* Paid Time Off


 Apply for this job

title: Software Development Engineer in Test - I
description:
**About GoKwik**
 GoKwik is a growth operating system designed to power D2C and eCommerce brands—from checkout optimization and reducing return\\-to\\-origin (RTO), to payments, retention, and post\\-purchase engagement. Today, GoKwik enables over 12,000 merchants worldwide, processes around $2 billion in GMV, and is strengthening its AI\\-powered infrastructure.Backed by RTP Global, Z47, Peak XV, and Think Investments, and bolstered by a $13 million growth round in June 2025 (total funding: $68 million), GoKwik is scaling aggressively across India, the UK, Europe, and the US.
   

  

**Why This Role Matters**
 Great software doesn’t just work—it inspires trust. As our Automation Engineer, you’ll ensure every release is bug\\-free, battle\\-tested, and ready to scale for India’s fastest\\-growing brands. Your work will directly impact the quality and reliability of products that millions of customers interact with every day.
   

  

**What You’ll Own**
* Automated Testing: Write clean, reusable automated tests with Playwright for web and mobile platforms.
* API \\& Component Testing: Validate APIs, reusable UI components, and backend services for flawless performance.
* Test Strategy \\& Frameworks: Drive quality using TDD, Page Object Model (POM), and frameworks like TestNG and Maven.
* Collaboration: Work closely with developers and product managers to release features faster—without compromising quality.
* Continuous Improvement: Identify gaps, propose solutions, and implement best practices to strengthen our QA processes.
* AI Integration: Candidates should demonstrate the ability to leverage AI tools (such as GitHub Copilot or ChatGPT) to accelerate test script generation, optimize code refactoring, and assist in complex debugging to improve overall QA velocity.


**Who You Are**
* Proficient in automation suits and test automation tools like Playwright.
* Hands\\-on experience with API testing (RestAssured, Postman).
* Familiar with TDD, Page Object Model, and frameworks such as TestNG and Maven.
* A sharp eye for bugs, a passion for quality, and a builder’s mindset.
* Strong communicator who thrives in collaborative, fast\\-paced environments.


**Why GoKwik**
 At GoKwik, you won’t just witness the future of eCommerce—you’ll help build it. We’re a fast\\-growing, well\\-funded company solving complex problems at massive scale for thousands of brands. Expect an environment where ideas move fast, learning never stops, and your work leaves a real, measurable impact.
